subject: RE: [junit] Re: Recurrent testing with JUnit
msgSnippet: Thanks, I have been working with JUnitPP for the property mechanism. Indeed they have something for running tests with repetitions and invocation delays: java
messageBody:
RE: [junit] Re: Recurrent testing with JUnit

Thanks,
I have been working with JUnitPP for the property mechanism.
Indeed they have something for running tests with repetitions and invocation delays: java junit.extensions.PPTestRunner. I haven't found the time to try it out.

One other remark about JUnitPP: I used their ConfigurableTestCase. It worked well in a stand-alone environment, but in a server based environment (in combination with JUnitEE) it stopped the application server because of System.exit calls in their code. I informed the authors but got no feedback so far.

Instead I wrote something similar and called it ConfiguredTestCase but it is far less functional than ConfigurableTestCase, but at least it doesn't bring the application server down.

Just FYI.

Kind regards,

Dirk

-----Original Message-----
From: donkeyjote@... [mailto:donkeyjote@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 06, 2001 3:35 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: Recurrent testing with JUnit


Hi, Dirk. The Junit++ extension (a.k.a. JUNITPP) which is available
at junit.org is very helpful for repeating the same tests x number of
times, and you could easily add a wait time to the code that controls
the repetition--but I think they've only extended the non-GUI
TestRunner. At the very least, taking a look at JunitPP might be a
place to begin heading in the right direction. - DJ

--- In junit@y..., "LECLUSE Dirk (BMB)" <dirk.lecluse@p...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> Was wondering if there exists a JUnit extension that allows JUnit
to run
> tests every x minutes (every eg 30 minutes).
> Preferable this would run in a JUnit GUI like
junit.swingui.TestRunner, but
> with the option to check-enable repeatative testing, and specify an
interval
> like every x minutes.
>
> Repeatative testing is interesting to check a development that
depends on
> several dependancies (legacy applications) that tend to change over
time (eg
> go down, be modified, etc)
>
> I experimented to implement/extend junit.swingui.TestRunner but
without a
> lot of success so far.
>
> Any suggestions are welcomed.
> Thanks,
>
> Dirk Lecluse
